result.execSummary:
The defendant Donavon Scott Maki was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Sanders

3:05/3:36 PM Defendant Donavon Scott Maki in court, in custody.  Attorney Shanna Sanders in court for Donavon Scott Maki.  Attorney Cheniqua White appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads no contest to counts two and three. Court finds the defendant guilty. Court orders count two, 90 days Jail with full huber and count three, 9 months Jail with full huber. Sentence is concurrent with each other. Court costs due October 28 2022. 109 days credit. Count one is dismissed and read in.

David Zarwell and intern Margaret Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address and date of birth verified. Court sets $500 Cash Bond with conditions:   No contact directly or indirectly with victim N.H. or N.H.'s family, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Will allow non disorderly text contact with N.H.'s mother concerning N.H. only. Perliminary Hearing requested by zoom. Preliminary Hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 9:45 AM.

No contact directly or indirectly with victim N.H or any members of N.H;s family EXCEPT N.H's mother by text message only about other children, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere.
